author: nmelon
title: NFT Data Public API
description: A lot of upcoming apps, wallets and marketplaces rely on collection stats/NFT data, however it is time consuming to gather and maintain it.

f6_assessments.q0: NFTs have risen to be one of the main drivers for blockchain technology in a short span of time during the last few years. The traction NFTs bring have on-boarded lots of new blockchain and crypto enthusiasts. It is a great first step to on-board new talent and the mainstream crowd. By making Cardano a main driver in this department, we will increase the possibility of maintaining Cardano as an integral part of the blockchain ecospace in the future. The proposal aims to develop a public API for NFT data, this will save other developers lots of time so they can focus on other productive tasks. This will bring immediate  value to the Cardano ecospace. However, the proposal is objectively better suited in the “Developer Ecosystem” challenge which specifically requests for API’s and oracles to the developers. A score of 4 points will be given. This is because the proposal is placed in the “Dapps, Products & Integrations” challenge which has a somewhat strong coupling but a proposal assessor should also take into consideration if the proposal aligns with the challenge setting and it is better suited in the other category mentioned. One point will be deducted as a result, but overall the impact is rather good.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposing team have developed cnftjungle.io which already is a great addition to the Cardano ecosystem. Their credibility is high as a result and the feasibility is high. However, the job of a proposal assessor is to assess the proposal against the criteria set up by the Cardano community. And there are some points that are unfortunate, which could be avoided by further refining the proposal. For a starter the main risks are ignored by the argumentation “Nothing could prevent us from delivering the public api.”. This is simply not true, all projects pose risks in some way or another and it could be interpreted like ignorance from the proposers. A few examples of risk on the top of mind are bad cost estimates i.e. the budget is not enough and poor time estimates.
Furthermore, there is no calculation to back up the claim of 50.000 USD. Where does this number come from? How many hours of work do you estimate to this proposal? What is the hourly rate? What work has to be done? When does this work have to be done? 
These questions could be answered with a roadmap and a detailed plan with milestones. I believe the intentions of the proposers are great but it is hard to give a high score when fundamental details as the above mentioned are lacking. The previous experience weighs heavy but it cannot justify the flaws in the proposal, as a result, a neutral score will be given. 3 points.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal is lacking a few critical components to make it fully auditable by the community. There is no forum or public channel stated where you will share the progress of the development, this should be added so that the community can follow and evaluate your progress easier. A suggestion is to provide a blog section on your existing website where you provide these updates. 
There is no roadmap or detailed plan with a clear timetable, an ambitious community member could get a somewhat full picture by deriving information from different places in the proposal but it is recommended to compile this information and provide it as a regular roadmap with a detailed plan, time estimates and milestones. 
Also, measurable KPIs are lacking in order to evaluate the success of the project in an easy manner. This could be solved by adding something like “x amount of requests per month by time y” etc. At the moment, the proposal states that you will measure *how much* is done weekly. But it is not stated what your goals are, could one API call per week be considered a success? It is a rhetorical question but the point is probably clear, the community must be provided with KPIs to evaluate the project. If this is addressed, the proposal will receive a higher score in the future but at the moment, the proposal is lacking in terms of auditability and a score of 2 stars is given.

f6_assessments.q0: Currently Cardano has lots of NFT in the space but lacking in analytic tools. Many hidden gem did not receive the recognition it deserved. Thus this proposal address this issue. With an open source API to accurately track the data of each NFT platform would ease and benefit the community. More analytic tool will be spawned by this proposal, and with them on board, will drive more adoption and bring lots of benefit to the community. Thus, I strongly agree this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: With a working product (cnftjungle) that is being use by many of us. I have full confidence in the team that are executing this project. The milestones and deliverables are stated briefly. Though I would appreciate a detail breakdown on each deliverables. The cost breakdown are too brief as well, I would appreciate more details in it as well. Though the team is reputable and I have confidence in them. I can't give a perfect score due to the lackluster of information regarding the timeline and budget breakdown. All in all, I still believe this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: Though I understand that an API base solution is hard to provide indicators/metric to measure the success. But more information regarding them would be appreciated (i.e x number of calls per months etc). The proposal did mention that v1 would be completed in a month time and the team would be open to feedback, but the proposal lacks the feedback channel (i.e thru social media platforms/ github etc). There is a brief statement on how to measure the success of the proposal, but again would appreciate more information on the metric/indicator the quantify the success of this proposal. All in all, I stand neutral on the audit progress.

f6_assessments.q0: Many upcoming apps, wallets, and marketplaces rely on collection stats/NFT data, but gathering and maintaining it takes time. The proposer proposes to solve it by creating a public API that uses their Jungle database, which includes all NFTs and full historical sales, to provide all necessary data points for projects to use. This would be very helpful for new projects based around NFT and needs a lot of data collection. This does increase the efficiency of NFT ecosystem and thus helping cardano. This proposal effectively resolves the problem
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is the one who have built and are managing cnftjungle considering this it can be said the proposer has all the required experience and skills to successfully implement this proposal. They have requested a budget of $50,000 USD which seems expensive for the work needed to be done but they have provided a clear budget breakdown too. Therefore it's hard to justify the budget demanded. They aren't any risk involved to successfully implement this proposal. Have provided explanation about the plan. It can be safely said it is very likely this proposal will be implemented successfully. ! star has been deducted for not providing budget breakdown
f6_assessments.q2: This is simple proposal to create a public API As per the proposal the v1 of public API will be completed in a month and v2 of the same will take another month after analyzing the feedback received for v1. Therefore the proposer will be executed in 2 month and it can be audited easily by the community.  The success of the project will be availability of Fully completed and working public API using which upcoming projects can be built on. Based on all the above it can be said given info is sufficient to audit the development and success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This idea has a tremendous potential impact on how Cardano apps compute and analyze NFT data. The availability of a public API to access such data could help apps that are attempting to design a proprietary solution for the same process save a lot of time, money, and resources. The author offers a thorough strategy to permanently resolve the problem after fully grasping it. The team is open to expanding its API library in response to customer feedback and needs and does not limit itself to a specific set of data points. The chain and the Dapps using it will undoubtedly benefit from the most recent data access, which will gradually increase Cardano acceptance and ecosystem maturity. The team could have given the readers some proof of the background research done in accordance with the plan and also some information on the dangers and problems they might encounter during implementation, but the other information offered outweighs this shortcoming.
f6_assessments.q1: The quantity of information I have at my disposal as a reader to judge the viability of the plan worries me. The assertions of the proposer are not backed up by any concrete deadlines. Although we are aware that the CNFTjungle.io team would have assisted voters who are not familiar with the project, the proposer makes no attempt to introduce himself or any other team members who would be working on it. It is exceedingly improbable that the community will develop a sense of trust and confidence in the idea without knowledge of the team's standing or prior expertise. Despite the plan's approximate 2-month duration, it does not include a detailed action plan or budget breakdown beyond monthly end targets. The voters and community cannot assess the money's effective use without a viable bifurcation because the requested amount is not tiny. I advise the team to go back to the drawing board and return in the next rounds with more research and a clear game plan to support their proposal, taking into account the seriousness of the challenge the team is trying to solve and the type of idea they have. Additionally, I would adore it if the team recruited a few new members and introduced us to them.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer misses his or her chance to influence the auditability section readers. Readers are not given any early statistics to report on. Due to the unclear split of the proposed amounts, there is also not much to track. However, rather than relying solely on their reputation, the team that submitted ideas in this round should have taken the necessary steps to give such KPIs. Really, there is no way for the community to predict if the proposal will evolve in accordance with the requirements and expectations of the challenge. Again, it's not apparent what exactly has to be assessed. In any event, it would have been advantageous to have defined KPIs and reports to assess how money was distributed and successfully used. The team's many suggestions all exhibit the same pattern. It may be true that the team has a reputation and has been providing enormous value for a while, but it wouldn't be wise to rely just on that. In order for the voters to have faith in the group and the superb application they will create to solve the weaknesses of the ecosystem, I advise the team to provide the relevant evidence and information.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has pinpointed the need for a database of NFTs, and it provides a service that can satisfy this need for many individuals in the Catalyst community. I applaud the team's creativity and work in designing an algorithm to collect data for this DApp. With proper mass adoption, cnftjungle.io can be a huge deal and leverage Cardano in the cryptocurrency and NFT playfield.
f6_assessments.q1: While the proposal is short and not at all well-crafted, the website cnftjungle.io is quite self-explanatory. I am impressed by the website's volume of data and great design. The database platform is quite a winner-take-all field, and this project has the advantage of being the initiator in this field. With proper infrastructure maintainance and data expansion, there is no doubt that this project will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: As I have stated, the website is quite self-explanatory, and I believe I can find any information helpful for auditing the success of this project on the website. However, the proposal should be more carefully crafted, as many assessors will not access the website, and many non-tech individuals will not understand the depth of this project through the website.

f6_assessments.q0:
NFTs has provided multiple capabilities of preserving culture, history, boost creative talents and further solidifies digital proofs of ownership. However, there's no direct public repository for upcoming projects and wallets to easily get previous stats about existing NFTs for integration.
The proposer intends to develop a public API that will leverage CNFT Jungle database to provide all stats of NFTs in it's database thereby providing the necessary datapoints for projects/marketplaces/wallets. These will eventually ease integration and aid the developer ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
I have confidence in the team owing to the fact that they developed and maintained cnftjungle.io.
Also they provided some KPIs which includes but not limited to individual collection stats, marketplace volumes, single asset sales history, trait floors for both individual assets and collections which i think are relevant data endpoints necessary for the project. Timeline specifies that V1 public API will be out in a month in all possibility. However the budget is not properly presented and broken down to explain how the budget items add up to make the requested amount. (Team should consider providing a detailed budget breakdown on subsequent proposals incase they come for future funding rounds). Other than these, i think the team is capable of executing the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics and KPIs provided are sufficient tools to easily measure and track progress of the project. Team also proposes to release public API endpoints one after another to enable them track success and value. These together with a completely well packed working API on which projects can rely on is a unique metric to evaluate success of the project.

f6_assessments.q0:
Having an API makes life easier for developers. It saves time, effort and money. OpenCNFT also has a free API but it has certain restrictions. For example, transactions are limited to five pages. You can check out their API here: https://api.opencnft.io/1/#/Public/PublicController_getAssetTransaction.

The ability to have the full sales history for CNFTs available via an API will allow lots of teams, developers or analysts like myself to develop a diverse set of analytic tools. I have built a few analytics web apps but most were related to specific Cardano projects. This API allows for tools that include all NFTs in the Cardano ecosystem. This is a tool that everyone can use that will add value to the ecosystem especially in the CNFT space.
f6_assessments.q1:
The only reference link provided was to the proposers already working product, https://cnftjungle.io. Although this website is a great source of CNFT analytics, we as proposers need to evaluate this proposal and not an idea or previous works. According to the proposer there is “Nothing could prevent us from delivering the public api”. This could mean that the proposer did not give this section enough attention or that (s)he is too optimistic.

The budget was not clearly defined and no cost breakdown was given. This is very discouraging to see and shows how little effort was taken to outline the expected expenditure. The proposer should have a detailed budget, showing items and their costs respectively. The proposer has a dedicated discord server and could have asked the community for help in drafting a proper budget.
f6_assessments.q2:
The targeted problem is well described as “apps, marketplaces rely on collection stats/NFT data, however it is time consuming to gather and maintain it”. Yes this is true and having an API will definitely save these apps some time and money. However this proposal is about 240 words and comes across as rushed. The proposer should have spent more effort on it and given attention to all the sections so the PAs can assess a more complete proposal. 

There is no roadmap to see when milestones are expected to be completed. The proposer can make use of simple styles to display the roadmap like having months or quarters as heading and indicating the tasks to be completed for the respective month or quarter.

f6_assessments.q0: The impact of this proposal would make a positive impact toward reaching the goals of this challenge. The result would be an nft api that  would help a lot of projects so they do not have to replicate the same amount of work. The jungleNFT team already has one of the largest NFT databases.  By creating an API that accesses that data, this tool could save a lot of effort and time by a lot of projects who need to access historical NFT data. So overall, this proposal will have a positive impact, but I am unsure as to how great the impact. I am not certain that every proposal would want to access the jungleNFT database  even if they were looking for historical NFT data. Additionally I'm not sure that funding this proposal so that this team can implement an API on their own database would have as much impact as funding some of the other proposals in this challenge.  Ideally, at least to me, this seems like a tool that the team should develop and Implement on their own without Catalyst funding. So while I can see there would be a positive impact from this proposal I would prefer to see other proposals funded first.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal does not have enough information to fully assess the feasibility. There is a skilled incompetent team behind this project.  They have proven their ability to develop and market a successful NFT Marketplace. However, they did not provide any details or information regarding their timeline, development goals, or budget details. They are simply asking $50,000 and for us the trust that they will accomplish the goal without providing any details up front. This feels like a big ask. So I do not doubt the team or their ability, but as a proposal assessor I would have preferred a detailed and clear timeline of work to be accomplished  and a detailed breakdown of hours worked, wages,  and which part of the proposal would take how long. Given the lack of detail, but the experience of the team I can rate this proposal as nothing other than 3 due to my own uncertainty regarding feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2: The lack of detail regarding feasibility also spills over into the auditability.  The only  metric this team plans to measure is the completion and development progress of their API.There is no mention I'm staying on top of the development milestones because there are no development milestones. There is no obvious method they plan to report on to the community, and there is no clear plan to be transparent to project catalyst. However again, this team has succeeded at completing other projects so I assume they would know to report. The lack of  detail however creates confusion in my mind as to whether or not this is a serious proposal, or a quick way to infuse a little extra money into their development budget. If this proposal were to be rewritten with extra detail and resubmitted in the next fund, I could see them earning top scores.

f6_assessments.q0: In this proposal, a team wants to build a Public API which would be used for collection of data from NFTS. First of all, I think this is a great idea. This way, people could save more time and money to maintain their data in NFTs. Which would be great since maintaining NFTs isn't cheap. And it is really time-consuming to maintain NFTs. I gave 4 stars due to lack of information about the project. The project itself is not complicated, but more information about it should have been provided. I decided to give 3 stars since there isn't much information about the API, it should have been explained more, the idea isn't bad, and it would be useful but having more information is important too. There isn't much to say because of this.
f6_assessments.q1: In therms of feasibility, I decided to give 2 stars due to lack of text and needed information. The project itself is not complicated like a said, but the plan, team and budget breakdown really doesn't exist. The plan is very small, it is explained that it will be done in 2 months after getting feedback, but I should be explained more what will be done in first month. In the team section, we are provided with a link which leads to NFT website, and it doesn't lead to a detailed explanation about the team. The team seems experienced with NFT for having a NFT website, but having more information makes team more reliable and increase the chance to have this proposal successfully implemented. Same thing is with a budget, we only have how much money is needed, but we don't have for what is needed and for what will be used. More information would be better, and it would increase the chance of this proposal being successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: When it comes to auditability, it's the same thing. The success and the way it would be measured also has the lack of information. The text is short, like there is no provided information about the API, there could be at least that or detailed breakdowns. I can't give more than 2 stars for this. I really like the idea, but more information is needed. And these are the flows I saw.

solution: We will develop a public api offering using our Jungle database which consists of all NFTs, full historic sales (even pre-sc era from cnft.io) to provide all necessary data points for projects to use.
experience: We had build and maintained https://cnftjungle.io
